quotes.quote: The life of a mother is the life of a child: you are two blossoms on a single branch.
I'm beginning to perceive motherhood as a long, slow letting go, of which birth is just the first step.
Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands
Parents need to fill a child's bucket of self-esteem so high that the rest of the world can't poke enough holes to drain it dry.
Encourage & support your kids because 'Children are apt to live up to what you believe of them.
When you give a little of yourself to a child, you give a little of yourself to their future!
We never know the love of the parent till we become parents ourselves.
If you are a parent, open doors to unknown directions to the child so he can explore. Don't make him afraid of the unknown,give him support
Parenthood...It's about guiding the next generation, and forgiving the last.
Sometimes the strength of motherhood is greater than natural laws.
There is nothing that moves a loving father's soul quite like his child's cry.
I mean, when the world comes for your children, with the knives out, it's your job to stand in the way.
Parenthood is the opiate of the masses.
If we never have headaches through rebuking our children, we shall have plenty of heartaches when they grow up.
The danger of motherhood. you relive your early self, through the eyes of your mother.
It's our children who teach us how to be parents.
There is no such thing as a perfect parent. So just be a real one.
Whatever you would have your children become, strive to exhibit in your own lives and conversation.
Where parents do too much for their children, the children will not do much for themselves.
Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.
Parentage is a very important profession, but no test of fitness for it is ever imposed in the interest of the children.
The most important thing that parents can teach their children is how to get along without them
Stop trying to perfect your child, but keep trying to perfect your relationship with him.
Praise your children openly, reprehend them secretly.
Your children will become what you are; so be what you want them to be
Kids are like a mirror, what they see and hear they do. Be a good reflection for them.
The rules for parents are but three...love, limit, and let them be.
If your child has a weakness, teach them how to turn it into a strength! The only Failure is not trying.
Love is giving your kids your undivided attention and time
If you want your children to improve, let them overhear the nice things you say about them to others.
